channel.title: Amazing Podcast Episodes: ~2x curated episodes per week
channel.description: Curating & reposting the ~2 best podcasts per week. There are simply too many good podcasts out there, let us pick the best two each week for you. Copyright is owned by the publisher, not this podcast, audio is streamed directly from publisher's servers.
channel.itunes:subtitle: ~2x curated episodes per week
channel.itunes:author: Amazing Podcasts
channel.itunes:summary: Curating & reposting the ~2 best podcasts per week. There are simply too many good podcasts out there, let us pick the best two each week for you. Copyright is owned by the publisher, not this podcast, audio is streamed directly from publisher's servers.

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Amazing Podcast Episodes: ~2x curated episodes per week

item.title: The Moth: George Lombardi & Mary Navarre
item.description: A young doctor is whisked halfway across the globe to care for an ailing international religious icon and a Catholic school dropout searches for meaning.
item.itunes:author: Tim Ferriss: Bestselling Author, Human Guinea Pig
item.itunes:subtitle: A young doctor is whisked halfway across the globe to care for an ailing international religious icon and a Catholic school dropout searches for meaning.
item.itunes:summary: A young doctor is whisked halfway across the globe to care for an ailing international religious icon and a Catholic school dropout searches for meaning.

item.title: Tim Ferriss: Tony Robbins - On Achievement Versus Fulfillment
item.description: For those of you that aren't familiar, Tony Robbins is the world's most famous performance coach. He's advised everyone from Bill Clinton to Mikhail Gorbachev to Serena Williams, and Leonardo DiCaprio to Oprah (who calls him "superhuman").
item.itunes:author: Tim Ferriss: Bestselling Author, Human Guinea Pig
item.itunes:subtitle: For those of you that aren't familiar, Tony Robbins is the world's most famous performance coach. He's advised everyone from Bill Clinton to Mikhail Gorbachev to Serena Williams, and Leonardo DiCaprio to Oprah (who calls him "superhuman").

item.title: Recode Replay: Elon Musk, CEO, SpaceX and Tesla (Code Conference 2016)
item.description: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk talks with Recode's Kara Swisher and The Verge's Walt Mossberg about his plans to send a one-way rocket to Mars in 2018. He estimates colonists could start arriving on the Red Planet by 2025.
item.itunes:author: WNYC Studios and The New Yorker
item.itunes:subtitle: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk talks with Recode's Kara Swisher and The Verge's Walt Mossberg about his plans to send a one-way rocket to Mars in 2018. He estimates colonists could start arriving on the Red Planet by 2025.
item.itunes:summary: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk talks with Recode's Kara Swisher and The Verge's Walt Mossberg about his plans to send a one-way rocket to Mars in 2018. He estimates colonists could start arriving on the Red Planet by 2025.

item.title: The New Yorker: Politics and More: Mike Weisser Talks to Evan Osnos About the N.R.A.
item.description: The New Yorker writer Evan Osnos talks to Mike Weisser about guns, the N.R.A., and his unusual stance on firearms.
item.itunes:author: WNYC Studios and The New Yorker
item.itunes:subtitle: The New Yorker writer Evan Osnos talks to Mike Weisser about guns, the N.R.A., and his unusual stance on firearms.
item.itunes:summary: The New Yorker writer Evan Osnos talks to Mike Weisser about guns, the N.R.A., and his unusual stance on firearms.

item.title: Politico Off Message: Tony Blair - Centrism may be dead
item.description: Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair sits down with Glenn Thrush in London to discuss the relationship between American and British politics, his close relationship with the Clintons, Brexit, and the danger of approaching politics with a closed-mind.
item.itunes:author: POLITICO
item.itunes:subtitle: Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair sits down with Glenn Thrush in London to discuss the relationship between American and British politics, his close relationship with the Clintons, Brexit, and the danger of approaching politics with a closed-mind.
item.itunes:summary: Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair sits down with Glenn Thrush in London to discuss the relationship between American and British politics, his close relationship with the Clintons, Brexit, and the danger of approaching politics with a closed-mind.

item.title: Invisibilia: The Secret History of Thoughts
item.description: In "The Secret History of Thoughts," co-hosts Alix Spiegel and Lulu Miller ask the question, "Are my thoughts related to my inner wishes, do they reveal who I really am?" The answer can have profound consequences for your life.
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:subtitle: In "The Secret History of Thoughts," co-hosts Alix Spiegel and Lulu Miller ask the question, "Are my thoughts related to my inner wishes, do they reveal who I really am?" The answer can have profound consequences for your life.
item.itunes:summary: In "The Secret History of Thoughts," co-hosts Alix Spiegel and Lulu Miller ask the question, "Are my thoughts related to my inner wishes, do they reveal who I really am?" The answer can have profound consequences for your life.

item.title: Freakonomics Radio: Are You Ready for a Glorious Sunset?
item.description: The gist: we spend billions on end-of-life healthcare that doesn’t do much good. So what if a patient could forego the standard treatment and get a cash rebate instead?
item.itunes:author: Freakonomics Radio
item.itunes:subtitle: The gist: we spend billions on end-of-life healthcare that doesn’t do much good. So what if a patient could forego the standard treatment and get a cash rebate instead?
item.itunes:summary: The gist: we spend billions on end-of-life healthcare that doesn’t do much good. So what if a patient could forego the standard treatment and get a cash rebate instead?

item.title: The Tim Ferriss Show: The Interview Master: Cal Fussman and the Power of Listening
item.description: This episode is very special to me and features a verbal Jedi who never gets interviewed himself: Cal Fussman.
item.itunes:author: Tim Ferriss: Bestselling Author, Human Guinea Pig
item.itunes:subtitle: This episode is very special to me and features a verbal Jedi who never gets interviewed himself: Cal Fussman.
item.itunes:summary: This episode is very special to me and features a verbal Jedi who never gets interviewed himself: Cal Fussman.

item.title: The Ezra Klein Show: Bill Gates on stopping climate change, building robots, and the best books he’s read
item.description: Bill Gates is one of those people for whom “needs no introduction” is actually true. The polymathic Microsoft founder now leads the world’s largest and most important private foundation, and he’s predicting that we’re on the cusp of the energy breakthrough that’s going to save the world. He also talks about the controversial idea that technological innovation is slowing down, assesses how close we are to true artificial intelligence, and explains why you really want to save being sick for 20 years from now.
item.itunes:author: Vox / Panoply
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill Gates on stopping climate change, building robots, and the best books he's read
